properties.description: Dave's Botanical CoffeeShop is situated in the basement of City Church Liverpool. Access is via a short flight of stairs or a stairlift. Disabled toilets are available. We host a Community Meal on the first Tuesday of most months - which provides a free hot meal and a great opportunity for some social connection to folks in our community. Everyone is welcome. We also run a Friendship Group, which meets monthly on a Wednesday afternoon (weeks vary). This group is predominantly attended by seniors, but everyone is welcome. We have a short time of biblical reflection, a simple craft and there's always a cuppa and something to eat, as well as plenty of time to chat and have fun together! From time to time we hold other events and groups (like our summer Lego Club) that are open to the whole community to come and enjoy. For more details about these Warm Welcome groups, and our special social events please visit our website (linked below).
properties.title: Dave's Botanical CoffeeShop

properties.description: Kitty's Launderette is a community launderette and social space in the Everton/Anfield area of Liverpool. We're currently open 6 days a week (Closed Wednesdays) and offer a range of laundry services as well as a programme of free creative and social activities for our local community. We have been working with partner organisations to offer Free Washing Vouchers for those who might not have access to washers/driers. We are still offering this scheme so please ask our members of staff for more information.
properties.title: Kitty's Launderette

properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 14th October 2025** Church and Church Hall. The hall is used by many groups and Uniformed Organisations. Our Afternoon Guild starts on Tuesday 16th September at 2.30pm. This is a speaker meeting followed by refreshments. Cost is £3.00 per visit. It is on the 3rd Tuesday of the month except August. We will be open at 1.30pm for a start time of 2.00pm the second Tuesday of the month during October to April for a film afternoon. It is free admission and the film is followed by tea/coffee. We are also starting a "Craft and Sew" afternoon in October. Details to follow. Details will be on our website www.st-andrews-meols.org.uk We also have a Bible Discussion Group on the 1st (2.30pm) Tuesday of the month and a Prayer Group meeting on 2nd Thursday. Church is open for midweek Communion on the 3rd Wednesday of the month at 10.30. This is a short reflective service followed by tea/coffee. Please check our website for details.

hours._text: Tuesday: 13:30 - 16:30, Wednesday: 10:30 - 11:30 Monthly, Thursday: 14:30 - 16:00 Monthly, Sunday: 10:30 - 11:30

properties.title: St Andrew's United Reformed Church

properties.description: Church and church hall. The hall is used by many groups and Uniformed Organisations. On the 3rd Tuesday we have an Afternoon Guild. This is a speaker meeting and starts at 14.30. There is a small cost of £3.00 which includes light refreshments. On the 2nd Tuesday commencing 14th October we have a Film Afternoon. This is free admission with light refreshments. This starts at 13.45 for a film start time of 14.00. Also starting in October is a new venture "Craft and Sew". More details to follow. We also have a Bible Discussion Group on the 1st Tuesday of the month at 14.30 and a Prayer Group meeting on the 2nd Thursday of the month at 14.30. We have a monthly midweek Communion at 10.30am on the 3rd Wednesday. This is a short reflective service held in the foyer and is followed by tea/coffee.
properties.title: St Andrew's URC Meols

properties.address: The Hub@ St Peter's,, Woolton, Liverpool L25 5JF
properties.description: We are open as a Warm Welcome Space between 9am and 1pm Monday to Friday throughout the year, except for bank holidays and the weeks after Christmas and Easter. Anyone and everyone is welcome to come in and enjoy a hot drink and a biscuit or snack for free whenever they want to. Volunteers are around to chat and we've lots of books and games you are very welcome to use. We offer a variety of activity sessions run by volunteers throughout the week; a few of them have a low cost for resources or food. Many activities run for free with a voluntary contribution of £1pp for a drink and a snack or piece of cake. If you're going through a tough time and would like to join these sessions, please enjoy them for free.
properties.title: The Hub @ St Peter's, Woolton

properties.address: The Life Rooms Bootle, Merseyside L20 7AP
properties.description: The Life Rooms Bootle is open Monday to Friday from 9.15am to 4.45pm. We'll be offering free tea and coffee throughout the week, and on Wednesday lunchtime and Friday afternoons we'll be offering free soup. Visitors can sign up to free courses and social activities, and get practical advice from a Pathways Advisor who can point them in the right direction for help with social issues like housing, debt, finances, education, and more.
properties.title: The Life Rooms Bootle

properties.description: We will offer the Warm Space to the local community, called advertised as ‘Welcome Space’. There will be hot drinks served and a selection of cakes and biscuits. The session will run from 10.00am until 12 noon. There will be an activity offered such as knitting; Christmas craft; other seasonal craft; visitors talk from the community i.e.: LEAP (Warm Funding) CAP Christians against poverty. Toilet facilities are also available to attendees, including disabled access and nappy changing. Pre-school children will be welcome to this event, and activities can be provided if necessary. This will be advertised in the local supermarkets, schools and community library and Fazakerley Federation. It will also be communicated to the housing association Cobalt who are a strong presence in this area.
properties.title: Welcome Space
